item.title: Difference between risk and uncertainty
item.description: I was watching this lecture from professor Andrew Loo and he presented a compelling analogy to understand the difference between risk and uncertainty. The analogy goes as follows: urn A with 50 red balls and 50 black balls, pick a color and draw, if you draw your color you win $10,000. urn B with unknown quantities, pick a color and draw, same prize.
